member.summary: For logging

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.SocketWire.Base.myLifetime
member.summary: Lifetime of this wire. If counterpart disconnects, lifetime is not terminate automatically.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.SocketWire.Base.ReadArrayFromSocket(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads from into . Uses intermediate array with boundaries of already read. Method will block until we fullfill all .length bytes or timeout is thrown ( with ) or exception is thrown because socket is closed (sometimes local shutdown and doesn't cause Receive() to throw exception, so we have to use timeout) or return 0 bytes if other side invoked (in Java it's socket.outputStream.close())
member.param: bytes to read, method will return 'true' of it read all res.length bytes
member.returns: 'True' in case of successufull read. 'False' - socket was shutted down and - is less than .length (bufferred content is not enough).

member.name: T:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.ByteOrder
member.summary: Specifies the byte order.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.ByteOrder.Little
member.summary: Specifies Little-endian.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.ByteOrder.Big
member.summary: Specifies Big-endian.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode
member.summary: Indicates the status code for the WebSocket connection close.

remarks.para:
The values of this enumeration are defined in
Section 7.4 of RFC 6455.
"Reserved value" cannot be sent as a status code in closing handshake by an endpoint.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Normal
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1000. Indicates normal close.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Away
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1001. Indicates that an endpoint is going away.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.ProtocolError
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1002. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.UnsupportedData
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1003. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a type of data that it cannot accept.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Undefined
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1004. Still undefined. A Reserved value.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.NoStatus
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1005. Indicates that no status code was actually present. A Reserved value.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Abnormal
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1006. Indicates that the connection was closed abnormally. A Reserved value.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.InvalidData
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1007. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that contains data that is not consistent with the type of the message.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.PolicyViolation
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1008. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.TooBig
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1009. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big to process.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.MandatoryExtension
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1010. Indicates that a client is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server did not return them in the handshake response.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.ServerError
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1011. Indicates that a server is terminating the connection because it has encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.TlsHandshakeFailure
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1015. Indicates that the connection was closed due to a failure to perform a TLS handshake. A Reserved value.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Ext.EqualsWith(System.Int32,System.Char,System.Action{System.Int32})
member.summary: Determines whether the specified equals the specified , and invokes the specified Action<int> delegate at the same time.
member.param: An Action<int> delegate that references the method(s) called at the same time as comparing. An parameter to pass to the method(s) is .

member.name: T:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Fin
member.summary: Indicates whether a WebSocket frame is the final frame of a message.
member.remarks: The values of this enumeration are defined in Section 5.2 of RFC 6455.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Fin.More
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 0. Indicates more frames of a message follow.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Fin.Final
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates the final frame of a message.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.HttpVersion
member.summary: Provides the HTTP version numbers.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.HttpVersion.Version10
member.summary: Provides a instance for the HTTP/1.0.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.HttpVersion.Version11
member.summary: Provides a instance for the HTTP/1.1.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Mask
member.summary: Indicates whether the payload data of a WebSocket frame is masked.
member.remarks: The values of this enumeration are defined in Section 5.2 of RFC 6455.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Mask.Off
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 0. Indicates not masked.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Mask.On
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates masked.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Opcode
member.summary: Indicates the WebSocket frame type.
member.remarks:
The values of this enumeration are defined in
Section 5.2 of RFC 6455.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Cont
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 0. Indicates continuation frame.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Text
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates text frame.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Binary
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 2. Indicates binary frame.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Close
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 8. Indicates connection close frame.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Ping
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 9. Indicates ping frame.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Pong
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 10. Indicates pong frame.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Rsv
member.summary: Indicates whether each RSV (RSV1, RSV2, and RSV3) of a WebSocket frame is non-zero.
member.remarks: The values of this enumeration are defined in Section 5.2 of RFC 6455.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Rsv.Off
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 0. Indicates zero.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.Rsv.On
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates non-zero.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.WebSocketException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a fatal error occurs in the WebSocket communication.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Impl.WebSocketSharp.WebSocketFrameHeader.PayloadMaxLength
member.summary: Represents the allowable max length.

remarks.para: A will occur if the payload data length is greater than the value of this field.
If you would like to change the value, you must set it to a value between WebSocket.FragmentLength and Int64.MaxValue inclusive.

member.summary: Override this method to set-up data flow in your RdExt

member.name: T:JetBrains.Rd.Reflection.ReflectionRdActivator
member.summary:
To get maximal performance of Rd framework you should directly provide serializers to every Model and Property. Also, to maintain compability with Kotlin DSL you should not add any additional logic to your models.
Creating models by hand with this approach is tedious and error-prone. The main idea behind is to automatically create RdExt and initialize fields and properties with appropriate serializers.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Rd.Reflection.ReflectionRdActivator.myCurrentActivationChain
member.summary:
current activation stack.
used to protect from circular dependencies only.

Create and initialize RdModel root and its members (including nested RdModels)
It doesn't bind model to Protocol. You may want to use

member.name: M:JetBrains.Rd.Reflection.ReflectionRdActivator.ActivateRdExt(System.Type)

member.name: M:JetBrains.Rd.Reflection.ReflectionSerializers.CreateValueTupleSerializer``1
member.summary: Register serializer for ValueTuples

members.member:
Struct, Aggregate, ImmutableList are not supported.
This enbf-like scheme can only be used to understand basic concepts and terms, there is no any strong semantics behind several leaf rules.
// RdBasic, may have inexact mapping to C# types. IType ::= IBindable | IScalar Bindable ::= NullableBindable | Array[Bindable] | ImmutableListBindable | Class
IScalar ::= NullableScalar | NonNullableScalar NullableScalar ::= Maybe[NonNullableScalar] NonNullableScalar ::= List[IScalar] | Array[IScalar] | PredefinedType | Struct
NonNullableBindable ::= Array[Bindable] | IReadOnlyList[Bindable] | Class NonNullable::= NonNullableScalar | NonNullableBindable
FieldType ::= IScalar|IType|Aggregate
RdProperty ::= RdProperty[FieldType] RdSet ::= RdSet[INonNullableScalar] RdMap ::= RdMap[INonNullableScalar, INonNullable]
// C# declarations, [ and ] mean < >. FieldDeclaration[T] ::= C#(public readonly? T identifier) PropertyDeclaration[T] ::= C#(public T identifier { get; }) | C#(public T identifier { get; private set; }) // etc. // PropOrFieldDeclaration[T] ::= FieldDeclaration[T] || PropertyDeclaration[T] EnumDeclaration ::= C#(Enum[enum_const*]) // Not supported. No RdGenerator analogue. // StructDeclaration ::= C#(struct field* )
Member ::= RdProperty| RdList| RdSet| RdMap | RdModel Declaration ::= BindableDeclaration | Struct | Enum | RdExtDeclaration BindableDeclaration ::= TopLevel | Class
MemberDeclaration ::= PropOrFieldDeclaration[Member] RdModelMemberDeclaration ::= PropOrFieldDeclaration[Member|FieldType]
RdModelDeclaration ::= C#([RdModel] class {RdModelMemberDeclaration*}) | EnumDeclaration | ValueTuple[FieldType{1,7}] RdExtDeclaration ::= C#([RdExt] class {MemberDeclaration}* )
ROOT ::= RdModelDeclaration ROOT | RdExtDeclaration ROOT | Nothing
*
